intro: Crepis atribarba subsp. typica, commonly known as the typical bentgrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and pastures. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. The species is also notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments.
